title: E field map - potential differences between 4 pts

content.description: The figure shows an <math alttext="x y" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi><mi>y</mi></math>-coordinate system with a map of the electric field <math alttext="vector E" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mover accent="true"><mi>E</mi><mo>→</mo></mover></mstyle></math> due to a point charge that is not shown. The three points <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math>, <math alttext="Y" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math>, and <math alttext="Z" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Z</mi></math> are each located the same distance from Point <math alttext="P" overflow="scroll"><mtext>P</mtext></math>. Which of the following correctly compares the absolute values of the following potential differences?
content.question: <math alttext="the absolute value of V sub X, end sub, minus V sub P, end absolute value" overflow="scroll"><mo>|</mo><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>P</mtext></msub><mo>|</mo></math> between points <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math> and <math alttext="P" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi></math> <math alttext="the absolute value of V sub Y, end sub, minus V sub P, end absolute value" overflow="scroll"><mo>|</mo><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>Y</mtext></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>P</mtext></msub><mo>|</mo></math> between points <math alttext="Y" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math> and <math alttext="P" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi></math> <math alttext="the absolute value of V sub Z, end sub, minus V sub P, end absolute value" overflow="scroll"><mo>|</mo><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>Z</mtext></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>P</mtext></msub><mo>|</mo></math> between points <math alttext="Z" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Z</mi></math> and <math alttext="P" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi></math>

choices.label: <math alttext="the absolute value of V sub X, end sub, minus V sub P, end absolute value, equals the absolute value of V sub Y, end sub, minus V sub P, end absolute value, equals the absolute value of V sub Z, end sub, minus V sub P, end absolute value" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>|</mo><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>P</mtext></msub><mo>|</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>|</mo><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>Y</mtext></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>P</mtext></msub><mo>|</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>|</mo><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>Z</mtext></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>P</mtext></msub><mo>|</mo></mrow></math>

<math alttext="the absolute value of V sub X, end sub, minus V sub P, end absolute value, equals the absolute value of V sub Z, end sub minus V sub P, end absolute value, is greater than the absolute value of V sub Y, end sub, minus V sub P, end absolute value" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>|</mo><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>P</mtext></msub><mo>|</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>|</mo><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>Z</mtext></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>P</mtext></msub><mo>|</mo></mrow><mo>></mo><mrow><mo>|</mo><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>Y</mtext></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>P</mtext></msub><mo>|</mo></mrow></math>

<math alttext="the absolute value of V sub X, end sub, minus V sub P, end absolute value, is greater than the absolute value of V sub Z, end sub minus V sub P, end absolute value, is greater than the absolute value of V sub Y, end sub minus V sub P, end absolute value" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>|</mo><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>P</mtext></msub><mo>|</mo></mrow><mo>></mo><mrow><mo>|</mo><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>Z</mtext></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>P</mtext></msub><mo>|</mo></mrow><mo>></mo><mrow><mo>|</mo><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>Y</mtext></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>P</mtext></msub><mo>|</mo></mrow></math>

<math alttext="the absolute value of V sub Y, end sub, minus V sub P, end absolute value, is greater than the absolute value of V sub X, end sub, minus V sub P, end absolute value, equals the absolute value of V sub Z, end sub, minus V sub P, end absolute value" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>|</mo><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>Y</mtext></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>P</mtext></msub><mo>|</mo></mrow><mo>></mo><mrow><mo>|</mo><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>P</mtext></msub><mo>|</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>|</mo><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>Z</mtext></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>P</mtext></msub><mo>|</mo></mrow></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the absolute value of V sub X, end sub, minus V sub P, end absolute value, is greater than the absolute value of V sub Z, end sub minus V sub P, end absolute value, is greater than the absolute value of V sub Y, end sub minus V sub P, end absolute value" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>|</mo><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>P</mtext></msub><mo>|</mo></mrow><mo>></mo><mrow><mo>|</mo><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>Z</mtext></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>P</mtext></msub><mo>|</mo></mrow><mo>></mo><mrow><mo>|</mo><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>Y</mtext></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>P</mtext></msub><mo>|</mo></mrow></math>

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
